meanings.definition: (verb) To blow with a dull, roaring sound.
meanings.sent1: The wind began to wuther through the trees, creating a spooky atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the old house wuther as the storm approached.
meanings.sent3: The ghostly wuther of the wind outside made the children giggle nervously.
meanings.sent4: The wuther of the train passing by was like a distant thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The wuthering wind seemed to carry secrets from far away.
